info.name: Restful-Booker-project
info.description:
# üß™ Restful Booker API Testing Project

## üìå Description

This project demonstrates **manual API testing** using **Postman** for the [Restful Booker API](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com/).  
It covers the **CRUD operations** (Create, Read, Update, Delete) and authentication process for hotel booking management.

The goal is to validate API responses, verify data integrity, and ensure that all endpoints work as expected.

---

## üîó Base URL

## [https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com](https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com)

## üß∞ Tools Used

| Tool | Purpose |
| --- | --- |
| **Postman** | API testing and collection management |
| **GitHub** | Version control and documentation |

---

## üìÇ Folder Structure

RestfulBooker_API_Testing/  
‚îÇ  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Collections/  
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Restful-Booker-Collection.json  
‚îÇ  
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Environment/  
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ RestfulBooker_Env.json  
‚îÇ  
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md

---

## üöÄ Test Scenarios

| # | Endpoint | Method | Description | Auth Required |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | `/ping` | `GET` | Check if API is up and running | ‚ùå |
| 2 | `/auth` | `POST` | Create a token for authentication | ‚ùå |
| 3 | `/booking` | `POST` | Create a new booking | ‚ùå |
| 4 | `/booking/{id}` | `GET` | Get booking details by ID | ‚ùå |
| 5 | `/booking/{id}` | `PUT` | Update a booking (full update) | ‚úÖ |
| 6 | `/booking/{id}` | `PATCH` | Update a booking (partial update) | ‚úÖ |
| 7 | `/booking/{id}` | `DELETE` | Delete a booking | ‚úÖ |

---

## üß© Variables (in Postman Environment)

| Variable | Description | Example |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `base_url` | Base endpoint of API | `https://restful-booker.herokuapp.com` |
| `username` | user used for logging in to create token | `admin` |
| `password` | password used for logging in to create token | `password123` |
| `token` | Authentication token | `generated on firing API` |
| `created_bookingid` | ID of created booking | `generated on firing API` |
| `update_bookingid` | ID of created booking for full update | `generated on firing API` |
| `partial_update_bookingid` | ID of created booking for partial update (PATCH) | `generated on firing API` |
| `bookingid` | ID of created booking for Deletion | `generated on firing API` |

---

## ‚úÖ Expected Results

- **Status Codes:**
    
    - 200 ‚Üí Successful operation
        
    - 201 ‚Üí Resource created or Deletion
        
    - 403 ‚Üí Forbidden / Invalid token
        
    - 404 ‚Üí Resource not found
        
    - 400 ‚Üí Bad Request
        
    - 500‚Üí Internal Server Error
        
- **Validation Points:**
    
    - Response structure matches schema
        
    - Data consistency after CRUD operations
        
    - Token authentication required for update/delete
        

---

## üß† Author

üßë‚Äçüíª **Eslam Roshdy**  
üìß [esroshdy22@gmail.com](https://mailto:esroshdy22@gmail.com)  
üîó [GitHub Profile](https://github.com/EslamR0shdy94)

---

item.name: Auth
Auth Positive Scenarios
item.description:
üîπ Positive Scenarios

üìò Description:

Contains valid authentication test cases to ensure that a token is successfully generated using correct credentials.
The token will be saved as an environment variable (token) for use in other collections like Booking.

‚úÖ Example Test Case:

POST /auth with valid username and password ‚Üí expect 200 OK and a non-empty token.

item.name: Auth Negative Scenarios
item.description:
üî∏ Negative Scenarios

üìò Description:

Contains invalid authentication test cases to verify that the system properly handles incorrect or missing credentials.
Ensures the API returns meaningful error messages and proper status codes.

üö´ Example Test Cases:

Invalid username ‚Üí expect 200 OK with "reason": "Bad credentials"

Invalid password ‚Üí same as above

Empty body ‚Üí expect 400 Bad Request

Auth Collection

üìò Description:

This collection handles the authentication process for the Restful Booker API.  
It includes requests to generate a valid token required for performing operations such as update and delete on bookings.  
The token is generated using valid credentials and stored as a Postman variable to be reused in other collections.

This collection is designed to test the **authentication endpoint** of the Restful Booker API.

It is divided into two sub-collections to clearly separate successful (positive) and failed (negative) authentication scenari

üîπ Includes:

POST /auth ‚Üí Generate an authentication token.

‚úÖ Test Focus:

Validate successful token creation (status code: 200).

Ensure the token value is saved correctly in the environment variable (token).

Handle invalid credentials and confirm error message behavior.

item.description:
StartFragment

## ‚úÖ **Positive Scenarios**

üìò **Description:**

This folder contains all **successful test cases** for Booking endpoints.

Each request is designed to validate that the API correctly handles normal operations such as creating, updating, retrieving, and deleting bookings.

### üîπ Requests inside:

| # | Endpoint | Method | Purpose |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | `/booking` | `POST` | Create a new booking with valid data |
| 2 | `/booking/{id}` | `GET` | Retrieve an existing booking by ID |
| 3 | `/booking/{id}` | `PUT` | Fully update booking details using a valid token |
| 4 | `/booking/{id}` | `PATCH` | Partially update booking details |
| 5 | `/booking/{id}` | `DELETE` | Delete a booking with valid token |

üß© **Validation Focus:**

- Response status is `200` or `201`.
    
- Response body contains correct booking details.
    
- Token-based authorization works correctly for update/delete.
    
- Booking ID and fields are correctly stored as Postman variables.
    

EndFragment

item.description:
## ‚úÖ **1) Create Negative Scenarios (POST)**

\- **Description:**

This folder contains negative test cases for the **Create Booking (POST /booking)** endpoint.

The scenarios validate how the API handles invalid or incomplete booking data, such as missing required fields, incorrect data types or empty request bodies. These tests ensure the API returns proper error codes and does not create bookings when the input is invalid.

item.name: Retieve Negative Scenarios (GET)

exec: pm.test("Body has error message Not Found", function () {
pm.test("Body has error message Not Found", function () {

item.description:
## ‚úÖ **2) Retrieve Negative Scenarios (GET)**

**\-Description:**

This folder includes negative test cases for **Retrieve Booking (GET /booking/{id})**.

Scenarios cover requesting bookings using invalid IDs, non-existent IDs.

The purpose is to verify proper error handling and ensure the API responds with correct status codes for invalid retrieval attempts.

item.description:
## ‚úÖ **3) Full Update Negative Scenarios (PUT)**

**\-Description:**

This folder contains negative test cases for **Full Update Booking (PUT /booking/{id})**.

Tests focus on invalid booking IDs, missing or incorrect authentication tokens, invalid or incomplete request bodies, incorrect data formats, and attempts to update non-existing bookings. These cases ensure the API rejects invalid full update requests correctly.

item.description:
## ‚úÖ **4) Partial Update Negative Scenarios (PATCH)**

**Description:**  
  
This folder includes negative test cases for **Partial Update Booking (PATCH /booking/{id})**.  
  
Scenarios validate the behavior when updating a booking with invalid IDs, missing or incorrect authorization, unsupported fields, or invalid data types. The purpose is to ensure the API properly handles bad requests and denies unauthorized or malformed partial updates.

item.name: Delete Negative Scenarios (DELETE)

console.log(" Booking created successfully! ID:", bookingId);

item.description:
## ‚úÖ **5) Delete Negative Scenarios (DELETE)**

**\-Description:**

This folder contains negative test cases for **Delete Booking (DELETE /booking/{id})**.

The scenarios include deleting bookings with invalid IDs, missing/incorrect authentication tokens, or attempting to delete already-removed or non-existent bookings. Tests ensure the API returns appropriate error responses and prevents unauthorized deletion actions.

‚ùå Negative Scenarios

üìò Description:

This folder includes negative test cases that verify how the API handles invalid input, missing fields, unauthorized access, or incorrect booking IDs.  
These tests ensure the API returns proper error codes and messages.

üî∏ Requests inside:

# Endpoint Method Purpose

1 /booking POST Try to create a booking with missing required fields  
2 /booking/{id} GET Retrieve a booking using an invalid/non-existent ID  
3 /booking/{id} PUT Attempt to update without a token

4/booking/{id} PUT Try to update a booking with missing required fields  
4 /booking/{id} PATCH Attempt to update with an expired or invalid token  
5 /booking/{id} DELETE Delete booking without authentication or wrong token

üß© Validation Focus:

Verify error handling (403 Forbidden, 404 Not Found, etc.).

Ensure no booking is created/modified when input is invalid.

Validate response messages and structure for failed operations.

Booking Collection

üìò Description:

This collection contains all CRUD operations related to bookings on the Restful Booker API.  
It verifies the creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion of bookings, ensuring data consistency and correct response handling.

It is organized into two main sub-collections:

- **Positive Scenarios** ‚Üí Valid CRUD operations.
    
- **Negative Scenarios** ‚Üí Invalid or unauthorized actions to test error handling.
    

These tests ensure that the Booking API behaves correctly under both expected and unexpected conditions.

üîπ Includes:

POST /booking ‚Üí Create a new booking.

GET /booking/{id} ‚Üí Retrieve a booking by its ID.

PUT /booking/{id} ‚Üí Update an existing booking (full update).

PATCH /booking/{id} ‚Üí Update a booking partially.

DELETE /booking/{id} ‚Üí Delete a booking.

‚úÖ Test Focus:

Verify booking creation with correct data (status code 200 / 201).

Validate booking details (first name, last name, price, deposit, etc.).

Confirm that update and delete operations require a valid token.

Check response time and schema consistency.

item.name: Ping (Healthcheck)

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {

item.description:
Ping Collection

üìò Description:

This collection contains a simple health check endpoint for the Restful Booker API.
It‚Äôs used to ensure the server is running before executing other tests.

üîπ Includes:

GET /ping ‚Üí Check if the API is available.

‚úÖ Test Focus:

Validate the response status (201 or 200).

Assert that the response time is within acceptable limits.

Use as a pre-check before running the full test suite.
